TypeSignature.Value: public class ListCollectionView : System.Windows.Data.CollectionView, System.Collections.IComparer, System.ComponentModel.ICollectionViewLiveShaping, System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionViewAddNewItem, System.ComponentModel.IItemProperties

.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ListCollectionView extends System.Windows.Data.CollectionView implements class System.Collections.IComparer, class System.ComponentModel.ICollectionViewLiveShaping, class System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionView, class System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionViewAddNewItem, class System.ComponentModel.IItemProperties

Docs.summary: Represents the collection view for collections that implement <xref:System.Collections.IList>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you bind to a data collection, you may want to sort, filter, or group the data. To do that, you use collection views. You can think of a <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionView> as the layer on top of the binding source collection that allows you to navigate and display the source collection based on sort, filter, and group queries, all without having to manipulate the underlying source collection itself. If the source collection implements the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged> interface, the changes raised by the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged.CollectionChanged> event are propagated to the views.
All collections have a default <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionView>. For all collections implementing <xref:System.Collections.IList>, the ListCollectionView object is the default view object. The <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingListCollectionView> is the collection view class used for collections that implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.IBindingList>. To get the default view, you use the <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionViewSource.GetDefaultView%2A> method. For an example, see [How to: Get the Default View of a Data Collection](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
For more information about collection views, see [Data Binding Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.IList list) cil managed

Docs.param: The underlying collection, which must implement <xref:System.Collections.IList>.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, using a supplied collection that implements <xref:System.Collections.IList>.
Gets or sets the current active comparer that is used in sorting.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Collections.IComparer> object that is the active comparer.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the current active <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionView.Filter%2A> callback.
Docs.value: The active <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionView.Filter%2A> callback.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object AddNew() cil managed

Docs.summary: Starts an add transaction and returns the pending new item.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Calling AddNew starts an add transaction. You should call <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.CommitNew%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.CancelNew%2A> to end the add transaction. A new item always appears in the collection view. Any filtering, sorting, or grouping that is applied to the view is applied to the new item when <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.CommitNew%2A> is called.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object AddNewItem(object newItem) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified object to the collection.
Docs.returns: The object that was added to the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Calling the AddNewItem method starts an add transaction. You should call the <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.CommitNew%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.CancelNew%2A> methods to end the add transaction. A new item always appears in the collection view. Any filtering, sorting, or grouping that is applied to the view is applied to the new item when <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.CommitNew%2A> is called.

Docs.exception: An object cannot be added to the by using the AddNewItem method.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether a new item can be added to the collection.
Docs.value: if a new item can be added to the collection; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView> can create a new item for the collection if there is no edit transaction occurring, if the collection is not a fixed size, and if the <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView> can create an object of the correct type.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether a specified object can be added to the collection.
Docs.value: if a specified object can be added to the collection; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the CanAddNewItem property is `true`, you can specify an object to add to the collection by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.AddNewItem%2A> method. CanAddNewItem is `false` if items cannot be added to the collection.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the collection view can discard pending changes and restore the original values of an edited object.
Docs.value: if the collection view can discard pending changes and restore the original values of an edited object; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks CanCancelEdit is `true` if the edited item implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.IEditableObject?displayProperty=fullName> interface. If CanCancelEdit is `false`, call <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.CancelEdit%2A> to cause the view to exit the edit state and provide logic to revert the changes on the object that was edited.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CancelEdit() cil managed

Docs.summary: Ends the edit transaction, and if possible, restores the original value to the item.

remarks.format: ## Remarks CancelEdit sets <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.CurrentEditItem%2A> to `null` and causes the collection view to exit the edit state. If <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.CanCancelEdit%2A> is `true`, CancelEdit also restores the original values of the edited object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CancelNew() cil managed

Docs.summary: Ends the add transaction and discards the pending new item.
Gets a value that indicates whether the collection view supports turning filtering data in real time on or off.
Docs.value: in all cases.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the collection view supports turning grouping data in real time on or off.
Docs.value: in all cases.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the collection view supports turning sorting data in real time on or off.
Docs.value: in all cases.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the view supports callback-based filtering.
Docs.value: For a default instance of , this property always returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this property to test whether the current implementation supports filtering before assigning a callback to the inherited <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionView.Filter%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the collection view supports grouping.
Docs.value: if the collection view supports grouping; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether an item can be removed from the collection.
Docs.value: if an item can be removed from the collection; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks CanRemove is `true` if the collection is not a fixed size and if an add or edit transaction is not occurring.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the collection view supports sorting.
Docs.value: For a default instance of , this property always returns .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CommitEdit() cil managed

Docs.summary: Ends the edit transaction and saves the pending changes.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CommitNew() cil managed

Docs.summary: Ends the add transaction and saves the pending new item.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Any filtering, sorting, or grouping that is applied to the <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView> is applied to the new item when CommitNew is called.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Contains(object item) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether a given item belongs to the collection view.
Docs.returns: if the item belongs to the collection view; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method does not make any assumptions about whether the item belongs to the underlying collection. If you know that the item belongs to the underlying collection, it is more efficient to call <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.PassesFilter%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets the estimated number of records.
Docs.value:
One of the following:
Value
Meaning
-1
Could not determine the count of the collection. This might be returned by a "virtualizing" view, where the view deliberately does not account for all items in the underlying collection because the view is trying to increase efficiency and minimize dependence on always having the whole collection available.
any other integer
The count of the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Note that this count represents the filtered count.

Docs.summary: Gets the item that is being added during the current add transaction.
Docs.value: The item that is being added if <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.IsAddingNew%2A> is ; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets the item in the collection that is being edited.
Docs.value: The item in the collection that is being edited if <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.IsEditingItem%2A> is ; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a custom object that implements <xref:System.Collections.IComparer> to sort items in the view.
Docs.value: The sort criteria as an implementation of <xref:System.Collections.IComparer>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property causes an immediate refresh unless a <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionView.DeferRefresh%2A> is in effect.
Setting this property clears a previously set <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.SortDescriptions%2A> value.

Docs.summary: Begins an edit transaction of the specified item.

MemberSignature.Value: public override Predicate<object> Filter { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a method that is used to determine whether an item is suitable for inclusion in the view.
Docs.value: A delegate that represents the method that is used to determine whether an item is suitable for inclusion in the view.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an object that you can use to enumerate the items in the view.
Docs.returns: An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> object that you can use to enumerate the items in the view.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Enumerator instances are typically used for making asynchronous checks of the contents of a collection, or in this case, the contents of the view. For example, if you are about to start a `foreach` iteration over the contents of the view, it may be better to obtain an asynchronous copy to ensure that the length of the view items does not change unexpectedly midway through the loop.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance object GetItemAt(int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The zero-based index at which the item is located.
Docs.summary: Retrieves the item at the specified position in the view.
Docs.returns: The item at the specified position in the view.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method evaluates the index with any <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.SortDescriptions%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.GroupDescriptions%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionView.Filter%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.CustomSort%2A> properties that are set on the view.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a delegate to select the as a function of the parent group and its level.
Docs.value: A method that provides the logic for the selection of the as a function of the parent group and its level. The default value is .

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of objects that describe how the items in the collection are grouped in the view.
Docs.value: A collection of objects that describe how the items in the collection are grouped in the view.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > This property can only be set by accessing the collection object and using its various methods such as `Add`. The property to access the collection object itself is read-only; the collection itself is read/write.
## Examples The following example shows how to use this property:
[!code-cs[DataBindingLab#6](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/DataBindingLab/MainWindow.xaml.cs#6)] [!code-vb[DataBindingLab#6](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/DataBindingLab/MainWindow.xaml.vb#6)]
For the complete example, see [Data Binding Demo](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=163703).

Docs.summary: Gets the top-level groups.
Docs.value: A read-only collection of the top-level groups, or if there are no groups.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The items in the collection are of type <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionViewGroup>.

Docs.summary: Gets the complete and unfiltered underlying collection.
Docs.value: The underlying collection, which must implement <xref:System.Collections.IList>.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether an add transaction is in progress.
Docs.value: if an add transaction is in progress; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks You begin an add transaction by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.AddNew%2A> method, and you end the add transaction by calling <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.CommitNew%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.CancelNew%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the list of items (after applying the sort and filters, if any) is already in the correct order for grouping.
Docs.value: if the list of items is already in the correct order for grouping; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property to `true` informs the view that the list of items is already in the correct order for grouping and allows the view to use a more efficient algorithm to build the groups. The data is in the correct order if:
1. All items belonging to a given group appear consecutively, and
2. If the <xref:System.ComponentModel.GroupDescription.GroupNames%2A> collection is non-empty, the groups in <xref:System.ComponentModel.GroupDescription.GroupNames%2A> appear before any other groups, and in the same order as in <xref:System.ComponentModel.GroupDescription.GroupNames%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether an edit transaction is in progress.
Docs.value: if an edit transaction is in progress; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks You begin an edit transaction by calling the <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.EditItem%2A> method, and you end the transaction by calling <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.CommitEdit%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.CancelEdit%2A>.

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the resulting (filtered) view is empty.
Docs.value: if the resulting view is empty; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether there are groups in the view.
Docs.value: if there are groups in the view; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether filtering data in real time is enabled.
Docs.value: if filtering data in real time is enabled; if live filtering is not enabled; if it cannot be determined whether the collection view implements live filtering.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether grouping data in real time is enabled.
Docs.value: if grouping data in real time is enabled; if live grouping is not enabled; if it cannot be determined whether the collection view implements live grouping.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether sorting in real time is enabled.
Docs.value: if sorting data in real time is enabled; if live sorting is not enabled; if it cannot be determined whether the collection view implements live sorting.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of objects that describes the properties of the items in the collection.
Docs.value: A collection of objects that describes the properties of the items in the collection.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of strings that specify the properties that participate in filtering data in real time.
Docs.value: A collection of strings that specify the properties that participate in filtering data in real time.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of strings that specify the properties that participate in grouping data in real time.
Docs.value: A collection of strings that specify the properties that participate in grouping data in real time.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of strings that specify the properties that participate in sorting data in real time.
Docs.value: A collection of strings that specify the properties that participate in sorting data in real time.

Docs.returns: if the resulting <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionView.CurrentItem%2A> is an item within the view; otherwise, .

Docs.value: One of the enumeration values that specifies the position of the new item placeholder in the .

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnAllowsCrossThreadChangesChanged() cil managed

Docs.summary: Occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionView.AllowsCrossThreadChanges%2A> property changes.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnBeginChangeLogging(class System.Collections.Specialized.NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs args) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs> object that is added to the change log.
Docs.summary: Called by the base class to notify the derived class that a <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged.CollectionChanged> event has been posted to the message queue.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The purpose of this notification is to allow collection views to take a snapshot of the information, which is often the state of the data collection, that is needed at the time of the post.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool PassesFilter(object item) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the specified item in the underlying collection belongs to the view.
Docs.returns: if the specified item belongs to the view or if there is not filter set on the collection view; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Unlike the <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.Contains%2A> method, this method assumes that the specified item belongs to the underlying collection. This method takes filters into account. Typically, you use this method during collection-changed notifications to determine whether the added or removed item requires processing.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void ProcessCollectionChanged(class System.Collections.Specialized.NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs args) cil managed

Docs.summary: Handles <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged.CollectionChanged> events.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void RefreshOverride() cil managed

Docs.summary: Recreates the view.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Remove(object item) cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes the specified item from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If `item` is not in the collection, Remove does nothing.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RemoveAt(int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the item to remove.
Docs.summary: Removes the item at the specified position from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `index` is relative to the collection view, not the collection. For example, if the collection has 10 items and the view has a <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICollectionView.Filter%2A> so that 7 items appear, the valid values of `index` are 0 through 6.

Docs.exception: is less than 0 or greater than the number of items in the collection view.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of objects that describes how the items in the collection are sorted in the view.
Docs.value: A collection of objects that describe how the items in the collection are sorted in the view.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > This property can only be set by accessing the collection object and using its various methods such as `Add`. The property to access the collection object itself is read-only; the collection itself is read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 System.Collections.IComparer.Compare(object o1, object o2) cil managed

Docs.summary: This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.returns: A value that is less than zero means is less than a value of zero means the objects are equal; and a value that is over zero means is greater than .

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether a private copy of the data is needed for sorting and filtering.
Docs.value: if a private copy of the data is needed for sorting and filtering; otherwise, . The default implementation returns if there is an <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.ActiveFilter%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.ActiveComparer%2A>, or both.
